bill_title: deposit money in the permanent school fund for certain school and public lands adjacent to walk-in areas.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to deposit money in the permanent school fund for certain school and public lands adjacent to walk-in areas. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 41-2 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Beginning in 2015 and each year thereafter, for each tract of school and public lands that is open to public hunting and is adjacent to private property designated by the Department of Game, Fish and Parks as a walk-in area, the Department of Game, Fish and Parks shall transfer money from the Department of Game, Fish and Parks fund to the permanent school fund established pursuant to S.D. Const., Art. VIII, § 2. The amount of money transferred for each acre in the tract shall be equal to the average amount paid per acre during the previous calendar year to landowners of the adjacent property under the walk-in area program. 170 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.098 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
